page.title: 04WEST HULL'S NEW TRUNK ROAD
page.content: THE M62 HAS, FOR YEARS FED ALL OUT OF TOWN TRAFFIC INTO WEST HULL ALONG THREE MAIN ROADS: ANLABY, BOOTHFERRY AND HESSLE ROADS. MUCH OF THIS WAS GOING THROUGH TO THE EAST. A FEW YEARS AGO CONSTRUCTION BEGAN ON A DUAL CARRIAGEWAY OUTSIDE HULL. THIS IS NEARLY FINISHED, AND COMES INTO W.HULL SOUTH OF ALL EXISTING ROADS ALONG PREVIOUS DOCK AND RAILWAY LAND AND VERY CLOSE TO THE HUMBER ESTUARY. IT EVENTUALLY PASSES SOUTH OF THE CITY CENTRE. THE PLAN WAS TO REDUCE HEAVY TRAFFIC IN THE BUILT UP AREAS. BUT NOT EVERYONE IS HAPPY. SOME TRADERS HAVE OBJECTED TO THE PLAN TO BLOCK OFF PART OF THE MOST SOUTHERLY ROUTE: HESSLE RD. DESIGNED TO FORCE TRAFFIC TO KEEP TO THE NEW ROAD TRADERS ARE FEARFUL FOR THEIR BUSINESSES.
